sect1.title: NORMALIZE

row.entry: The set of records to process.
A numeric expression specifying the total number of times to call the transform for that record.
The TRANSFORM function to call for each record in the recordset.
The field name of a child DATASET in the recordset. This must use the keyword LEFT as its qualifier.

sect1.para: The NORMALIZE function normalizes child records out of a recordset where the child records are appended to the end of the parent data records. The purpose is to take variable-length flat-file records and split out the child information. The parent information can easily be extracted using either TABLE or PROJECT.

sect2.title: NORMALIZE Form 1
sect2.para: Form 1 processes through all records in the recordset performing the transform function the expression number of times on each record in turn.

sect2.title: TRANSFORM Function Requirements for Form 1
sect2.para: The transform function must take at least two parameters: a LEFT record of the same format as the recordset, and an integer COUNTER specifying the number of times the transform has been called for that record. The resulting record set format does not need to be the same as the input.

sect2.title: NORMALIZE Form 2
sect2.para: Form 2 processes through all records in the recordset iterating the transform function through all the childdataset records in each record in turn.

sect2.title: TRANSFORM Function Requirements for Form 2
sect2.para: The transform function must take at least one parameter: a RIGHT record of the same format as the childdataset. The resulting record set format does not need to be the same as the input.
See Also: TRANSFORM Structure, RECORD Structure, DENORMALIZE
